comments:
I have defined a Jira Repository Query. In my task list, when I right click on that Query and press Synchronize, the error sometimes appears.
After an eclipse restart it appears to work fine - some time (and work...) later, it refuses to work correctly.

The following stack trace is located in eclipse' .log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-06-08 14:01:41.453
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Synchronizing queries: jira".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.web.JiraWebSession.doInSession(JiraWebSession.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.web.rss.RssJiraFilterService.findIssues(RssJiraFilterService.java:43)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.soap.JiraRpcClient.findIssues(JiraRpcClient.java:357)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.soap.JiraRpcClient.search(JiraRpcClient.java:348)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.JiraRepositoryConnector.performQuery(JiraRepositoryConnector.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:110)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-06-08 14:01:41.875
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Task Synchronization (1 tasks)".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.web.JiraWebSession.doInSession(JiraWebSession.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.web.rss.RssJiraFilterService.quickSearch(RssJiraFilterService.java:88)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.soap.JiraRpcClient.getIssueByKey(JiraRpcClient.java:182)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.JiraTaskDataHandler.getJiraIssue(JiraTaskDataHandler.java:88)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.JiraTaskDataHandler.getTaskData(JiraTaskDataHandler.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.syncTask(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:134)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeTaskJob.run(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Actually, the version in the problem description here is wrong: I was using Mylar 2.0M3 when the problem occurred.
Seems like 2.0M3 is missing in the version list.
Please try to update Mylar again making sure that you got all components by using Software Updates -> Search for new features... instead of "search for updates".  Let us know if that resolves it.
You're right, this problem is likely related to some installation trouble I had / have. I updated the installation again and will report here, if the above problem should occur again.

I just reproduced this with the latest dev build (20070607-1200).  Not yet sure what the cause is.  Hopefully we'll have a Mylyn dev build ready late today to investigate.

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/xml/rpc/ServiceException
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.JiraClientManager.createServer(JiraClientManager.java:171)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.JiraClientManager.addClient(JiraClientManager.java:182)
*** Bug 191663 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Fixed.  I had not updated the build.properties with a new library name after updating the manifest.
